kuusisto.tinysound

Interface Music

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemMusic, StreamMusic

    public interface Music
    The Music interface is an abstraction for music. Music objects should only be loaded via the TinySound loadMusic() functions. Music can be played, paused, resumed, stopped and looped from specified positions.
    Author:
    Finn Kuusisto

    • Method Summary

      Determine if this Music has reached its end and is done playing.

      Stop playing this Music and keep its current position.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        void play(boolean loop)
        Play this Music and loop if specified.
        Parameters:
        loop - if this Music should loop

      • play

        void play(boolean loop,
        double volume)
        Play this Music at the specified volume and loop if specified.
        Parameters:
        loop - if this Music should loop
        volume - the volume to play the this Music

      • play

        void play(boolean loop,
        double volume,
        double pan)
        Play this Music at the specified volume and pan, and loop if specified.
        Parameters:
        loop - if this Music should loop
        volume - the volume to play the this Music
        pan - the pan at which to play this Music [-1.0,1.0], values outside the valid range will be ignored

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop playing this Music and set its position to the beginning.

      • pause

        void pause()
        Stop playing this Music and keep its current position.

      • resume

        void resume()
        Play this Music from its current position.

        void rewind()
        Set this Music's position to the beginning.

      • rewindToLoopPosition

        void rewindToLoopPosition()
        Set this Music's position to the loop position.

      • playing

        boolean playing()
        Determine if this Music is playing.
        Returns:
        true if this Music is playing

      • done

        boolean done()
        Determine if this Music has reached its end and is done playing.
        Returns:
        true if this Music is at the end and is done playing

      • loop

        boolean loop()
        Determine if this Music will loop.
        Returns:
        true if this Music will loop

        void setLoop(boolean loop)
        Set whether this Music will loop.

        Returns:
        loop position by seconds

      • setLoopPositionByFrame

        void setLoopPositionByFrame(int frameIndex)
        Set the loop position of this Music by sample frame.
        Parameters:
        frameIndex - sample frame loop position to set

      • setLoopPositionBySeconds

        void setLoopPositionBySeconds(double seconds)
        Set the loop position of this Music by seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - loop position to set by seconds

      • getVolume

        double getVolume()
        Get the volume of this Music.
        Returns:
        volume of this Music

      • setVolume

        void setVolume(double volume)
        Set the volume of this Music.
        Parameters:
        volume - the desired volume of this Music

      • getPan

        double getPan()
        Get the pan of this Music.
        Returns:
        pan of this Music

      • setPan

        void setPan(double pan)
        Set the pan of this Music. Must be between -1.0 (full pan left) and 1.0 (full pan right). Values outside the valid range will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        pan - the desired pan of this Music

      • unload

        void unload()
        Unload this Music from the system. Attempts to use this Music after unloading will result in error.
